subject: Add meson build
commitMessage:
Add meson build

This commit is to add meson build.
and later, we will remove Autotools and replace it with meson build.

Tested: built openpower-occ-control successfully and Unit test passes.

Signed-off-by: George Liu <liuxiwei@inspur.com>
Change-Id: I7f5fbc7150194a78f9b36bb256613fc70b834130

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as bddcf853b643f4daf094d687bbb7043692e7ecbe by Edward A. James
Didn't this used to be an option?

Yes, this did not used to be an option, the default setting is 2.
https://github.com/openbmc/openpower-occ-control/blob/master/configure.ac#L127

we set it here as an option: https://github.com/ibm-openbmc/openbmc/blob/ibm-1020-30.0-public/meta-ibm/recipes-phosphor/occ/openpower-occ-control_%25.bbappend#L1

(In P10 I added code to detect how many OCCs there are, but there could still be people out there doing the bbappend thing)
Got it, will update

Updated, like this:

```
EXTRA_OEMESON:append = " \
    -Dmax-cpus=4 \
    "
```
I've seen problems with meson changeovers before where conf data would now require a '#if' as opposed to an '#ifdef'.  Seems like this will be OK how it is?

Right, About mesnon build, Please see the following link:
https://mesonbuild.com/Build-options.html#build-options
think , this is needed only when with-host-communication-protocol is enabled. why are we checking for this dependency irrespective of features being enabled ?
Done
duplicate var ?
Done
You might want to check in a small script, like the one in phosphor-dbus-interfaces, to help point people to how to regenerate this.
Done
Overall we're moving away from putting these concepts in the build config.  We find that nobody ever needs to change them anyhow (nor would you want to).

Yes.
I just switched from autotools to meson build, Let me update it in the next commit.
These won't work for wrap-style builds, but it is fine to start with this and add wraps later on.
Ack
Can you keep this one in the same order as the others (python_prog)?
Done
It would be good if we could work to do away with this complexity.  I was able to get rid of it with the phosphor-logging, so we should be able to do it here also.
Thanks, I want update it in another patch.
Generally the convention in meson is to name this 'sdbusplus_dep'.
Done
Can you consolidate this and line 104?
Done
Should we improve the line wrapping on these?
Done
I don't know if this is intentional or not but you've modified the root-level variable as well so the main executable will now get pthread as a dependency.  I suspect that wasn't what you expected.

Done

Removed it from deps and use `pthread_dep`
wrong description
